perturbation.original_text:
Any payments which have not been received by PCQ within thirty (30) days of the Invoice date shall be subject to a FINANCE CHARGE of 1.0% per month which is a corresponding ANNUAL
PERCENTAGE RATE of 12% on the outstanding balance.
perturbation.changed_text:
Any payments which have not been received by PCQ within thirty (30) days of the Invoice date may, at PCQ's discretion, be subject to a FINANCE CHARGE of 1.0% per month which is a corresponding ANNUAL
PERCENTAGE RATE of 12% on the outstanding balance.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a mandatory finance charge for late payments. The modified version makes the finance charge discretionary ('may, at PCQ's discretion'), creating uncertainty about whether late fees will be applied. This introduces a contradiction because the original text implies a consistent policy, while the modified text allows for inconsistent application of late fees.

perturbation.original_text:
ABW agrees to field all initial customer support requests and assist its clients to the best of its knowledge and ability.  If the support issue is
of a complex nature that ABW is unable to solve, ABW may forward the call on to
the PCQ technical support staff.
perturbation.changed_text: ABW agrees to field all initial customer support requests and assist its clients to the best of its knowledge and ability. ABW is solely responsible for all customer support requests, and under no circumstances shall ABW forward any support request to PCQ.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that ABW could forward complex support requests to PCQ. The modified version states that ABW is solely responsible for all support and cannot forward requests to PCQ. This directly contradicts the original provision, creating uncertainty about which party is ultimately responsible for resolving complex customer issues.

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects
in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, except with regards to its
rules regarding choice of law.  Each party irrevocably consents to the
jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Illinois and the federal courts
situated in the State of Illinois, in connection with any action to enforce the
provisions of this Agreement, to recover damages or other relief for breach or
default under this Agreement, or otherwise arising under or by reason of this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, except with regards to its rules regarding choice of law. Each party consents to the jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Delaware in connection with any action to enforce the provisions of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies Illinois law and Illinois courts for disputes. The modified version specifies New York law and Delaware courts. This direct contradiction creates uncertainty about which jurisdiction's laws apply and where legal disputes must be resolved.
